help-file.title: GUILDS ASSOCIATIONS CLANS
help-file.content:
This document is designed to answer any questions regarding the creation of player guilds on Duris. Under the current guild system players are responsible for the organization of their own guilds. The gods themselves will not be responsible or serve any function in the running of a guild.
How To Begin A Guild ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
a) The requirements for forming a guild are as follows : -All guild members must be at least 25th level or above. The level requirement is simply to ensure that the people in the guild are familiar with Duris and how it's run. -A guild may have upto, but no more than, 3 shared characters. These characters can be accessable by some/all members of the guild, but are not directly owned by anybody in the guild. -Guilds must also keep a member count of at least 5 members, this 5 does NOT include the 3 shared characters. The guild is also limited to a maximum of 35 members in the guild at a time. -A one time fee of 1,000 platinum is required to start the guild. This not does include a guildhall.
IMPORTANT -You may only have one character in a guild, and at most one alt in the SAME GUILD, at a time. No exceptions. -You as a player can only secede from three different guilds EVER. If you leave your third different guild, that's it. -If you leave a guild you must wait one real week before joining another. -You may only kick out one member per mud month at a time.
b) What this allows -Once this happens the guild will be created and the person forming the guild will be flagged as a guild 'leader'. This will allow him/her to recruit members into the guild and promote/demote them accordingly. This is done completely without god interference and controlled by the code. Any new members will be automatically be flagged and titled as a member of the guild. This also will create a guild bank account which is accessible by Leaders and Deputies. Once a guild has been started and approved by Duris, the guild members of that guild must run their own activities. How many people there are of a certain guild rank is entirely up to the players. The gods themselves will have no interference with the running of the guild themselves. Any new members, once enrolled will automatically be titled as a basic member of that guild.
Guild Structure --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Guilds have specific ranks within them which give their members to ability do different things depending on their rank. How this works is as follows :
Leader -A leader can change the names of all the ranks (this allows an guild of sorcerers to name the leader as "ArchMage" rather than "Leader". These titles must be realistic in a fantasy world. A leader also has the ability to flag a player as an enemy to the guild (leaders are the only ones that can remove this flag as well). The leader can also add on an 'on parole' flag to members.
Deputy -A deputy (or higher) can delete, promote and demote members and also has access to withdraw money from the guild's bank account.
Officer -An officer (or higher) has the right to fine lower members (dealing out punishments etc).
Senior member -A senior member (or higher) has the right to enroll new members.
Normal member -A Normal member just has general abilities, access to any guildhalls that might be available etc. They can also see what other guild members are online.
Enemy -The guild leader has the ability to flag a member as a guild enemy as well. This will cause the guild npc's (if any) to attack the player on sight and is used for betrayal etc.
Applying for Membership --------------------------------------------------------------------------- In order to be allowed into a guild the player must first apply himself as an applicant. You can do this by using the 'Society Apply <member>' command where <member> is the enrolling member of the guild you wish to join.
Guild Locker --------------------------------------------------------------------------- All guilds currently have a guild locker. Go to any bank in a hometown where you can access your personal locker, and you can access your guild locker with enter locker guild. All members share access to this locker. This replaces the need for guild chests in guildhalls.
